text: Hi guys, I've created a small Express server to play with the HubSpot API. I currently have a case where a customer wants to enrich HubSpot data with an external API. Using the HubSpot webhooks and API this would be relatively easy to develop. Where do you guys host your integrations? What are your experiences with the HubSpot API? I'd rather not use an existing solution like Zapier but just build a small server myself. Love to hear from you.
how to get list of topics that has published post only?

if it’s a small server/ simple app, i usually just deploy my code to heroku <https://id.heroku.com/login>. its suuuuuper simple and easy to set up, and gives you a URL to host your endpoints on. Otherwise, <http://repl.it|repl.it> is a great service where you dont have to actually deploy anything. You write your code and get a live URL out of the box. It’s not perfect though so sometimes there are some weird quirks but overall its solid <https://repl.it/repls>
<@UDDJG2VFG> I trying to create contact with custon contact properties. it say invalid value.
I used this as my reference
heres a quick express server i wrote to test HubSpot webhooks a while ago <https://repl.it/@cbarley10/WorkflowWebhookValidation>
Anyone can help me with issue on contact API, I try to add new contact. It's work fine with default field. But when I tried a new properties under new group. It has error.

Digital Ocean is my go-to. pretty straightforward in terms of just spinning up a VPS and letting you SSH in. Every time I've used Heroku I've found it a bit too opinionated in terms of deployment workflow, but that was also just for RoR apps, so maybe it is different for other stacks.
